newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks end up 2.1 pct in pre-budget rally.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks end up 2.1 pct in pre-budget rally.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended 2.15 percent up in a pre-budget rally that took the 100-share index over the 1,600-point psychological barrier on Tuesday, dealers said.

The Karachi index ended 33.81 points, or 2.15 percent, up at 1,605.93 amid 142 gainers and 132 losers. The index rose some 75 points since Monday on speculative buying in blue chips before Friday's 1997/98 (July-June) budget, dealer Salman Naqvi said.
The index was likely to rise further in computerised trading in the evening, he said. Hub Power rose 0.90 rupee to 41.40 at 14.20 p.m.(0920 GMT). -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
